title: Passwords Exported in ClearText (.csv)
author: PCNerd2001
body_snippet:
When exporting connections using the .csv, the password is displayed in clear text.  The doesn't occur when exporting to .xml.

To reproduce on Windows 10 build (1803):
1.  Select File, Export to File.
2.  Select the file format for .csv.
3.  Export and open file.

iterations.description: CSV export includes plaintext passwords, creating a security risk when files are shared or stored without encryption.

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet:
There is really no way for us to export and then re-import encrypted text using csv format in a nice way. We need to provide a number of details in the .xml format to tell mRemoteNG how to decrypt it. If we do the same in csv format, we need to include that data in every row of the csv. If we provide the encrypted value but no indication of how it was encrypted, then it will be essentially impossible to decrypt it. Why provide the value at all, at that point?

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet: For that matter, the external tools window should provide a similar warning when tools include the `%Password%` variable. It would be good practice for us to warn users about these clear text password situations.

comments.author: PCNerd2001
comments.snippet: Thanks for the response!  I appreciate your hard work and a great product.

notes:
AI triage (claude): CSV export includes plaintext passwords, creating a security risk when files are shared or stored without encryption.
Approach: Omit password fields from CSV export by default, or prompt user with a warning and require explicit opt-in before including plaintext credentials.
